item.title: What is FIFO in Computer Science? An Easy-to-Understand Example
item.description: Understanding FIFO FIFO stands for “First In, First Out.” It’s a method used to manage and organize data, ensuring that the first element added is the first one to be removed. This principle is akin to the way people line up in a queue; the first person to join the line is the first one to be served. FIFO is widely used in various computer science applications, such as data structures, operating systems, and networking.
